intro: Eleogiton elongantha, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with characteristic milky sap. The plant is typically shrub-like, with simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is generally avoided by livestock and humans.
